papers.title: Verifiable Private Information Retrieval
papers.authors: Shany Ben-David, Yael Tauman Kalai, Omer Paneth
papers.abstract: . A computational PIR scheme allows a client to privately query a database hosted on a single server without downloading the entire database. We introduce the notion of veriﬁable PIR (vPIR) where the server can convince the client that the database satisﬁes certain properties without additional rounds and while keeping the communication sub-linear. For example, the server can prove that the number of rows in the database that satisfy a predicate P is exactly n . We deﬁne security by modeling vPIR as an ideal functionality and following the real-ideal paradigm. Starting from a standard PIR scheme, we construct a vPIR scheme for any database property that can be veriﬁed by a machine that reads the database once and maintains a bounded size state between rows. We also construct vPIR with public veriﬁcation based on LWE or on DLIN. The main technical hurdle is to demonstrate a simulator that extracts a long input from an adversary that sends a single short message. Our vPIR constructions are based on the notion of batch argument for NP. As contribution of independent interest, we show that batch arguments are equivalent to quasi-arguments—a relaxation of SNARKs which is known to imply succinct argument for various sub-classes of NP.
papers.abstract_zh: 。计算PIR方案允许客户私下查询单个服务器上的数据库，而无需下载整个数据库。我们引入了可验证PIR (vPIR)的概念，在这种情况下，服务器可以让客户端相信数据库满足某些属性，而无需额外的循环，同时保持通信亚线性。例如，服务器可以证明数据库中满足谓词P的行数正好是n。我们通过将vPIR建模为理想功能并遵循真实理想范式来定义安全性。从标准PIR方案开始，我们为任何数据库属性构建了一个vPIR方案，该数据库属性可以由读取数据库一次并在行之间保持有限大小状态的机器来验证。我们还构建了基于LWE或DLIN的公开验证的vPIR。主要的技术障碍是演示一个模拟器，从发送一条短消息的对手那里提取一个长输入。我们的vPIR构造是基于NP的批量自变量的概念。作为独立兴趣的贡献，我们证明了批论元等价于准论元——众所周知，这意味着NP的各种子类的简洁论元的一种放松。

papers.title: Adaptive Versus Static Multi-oracle Algorithms, and Quantum Security of a Split-Key PRF
papers.authors: Jelle Don, Serge Fehr, Yu-Hsuan Huang
papers.abstract: In the ﬁrst part of the paper, we show a generic compiler that transforms any oracle algorithm that can query multiple oracles adaptively , i.e., can decide on which oracle to query at what point dependent on previous oracle responses, into a static algorithm that ﬁxes these choices at the beginning of the execution. Compared to naive ways of achieving this, our compiler controls the blow-up in query complexity for each oracle individually , and causes a very mild blow-up only. In the second part of the paper, we use our compiler to show the security of the very eﬃcient hash-based split-key PRF proposed by Giacon, Heuer and Poettering (PKC 2018), in the quantum random-oracle model. Using a split-key PRF as the key-derivation function gives rise to a secure KEM combiner. Thus, our result shows that the hash-based construction of Giacon et al. can be safely used in the context of quantum attacks, for instance to combine a well-established but only classically-secure KEM with a candidate KEM that is believed to be quantum-secure.Oursecurityproof for the split-key PRF crucially relies on our adaptive-to-static compiler, but we expect our compiler to be useful beyond this particular application. Indeed, we discuss a couple of other, known results from the literature that would have proﬁtted from our compiler, in that these works had to go though serious complications in order to deal with adaptivity.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文的第一部分，我们展示了一个通用编译器，它可以将任何可以自适应地查询多个oracle的oracle算法(即，可以根据以前的oracle响应决定在什么时候查询哪个Oracle)转换为一个静态算法，在执行开始时调整这些选择。与实现这一点的简单方法相比，我们的编译器单独控制了每个oracle的查询复杂性的增加，并且只引起非常轻微的增加。在论文的第二部分，我们使用我们的编译器在量子随机预言模型中展示了由Giacon，Heuer和Poettering (PKC 2018)提出的非常eﬃcient的基于散列的分裂密钥PRF的安全性。使用分裂密钥PRF作为密钥导出函数产生了安全的KEM组合器。因此，我们的结果表明Giacon等人的基于散列的构造可以安全地用在量子攻击的环境中，例如将一个公认的但只是经典安全的KEM与一个被认为是量子安全的候选KEM相结合。我们对split-key PRF的安全性防范主要依赖于我们的自适应静态编译器，但是我们希望我们的编译器在这个特定的应用之外还有用处。事实上，我们讨论了文献中的几个其他已知结果，这些结果将由我们的编译器提供，因为这些工作必须经历严重的复杂性，以便处理适应性。
papers.title_zh: 自适应与静态多oracle算法，以及分裂密钥PRF的量子安全性

papers.title: Pseudorandom (Function-Like) Quantum State Generators: New Definitions and Applications
papers.authors: Prabhanjan Ananth, Aditya Gulati, Luowen Qian, Henry Yuen
papers.abstract: Pseudorandom quantum states (PRS) are efficiently constructible states that are computationally indistinguishable from being Haar-random, and have recently found cryptographic applications. We explore new definitions, new properties and applications of pseudorandom states, and present the following contributions: 1. New Definitions: We study variants of pseudorandom function-like state (PRFS) generators, introduced by Ananth, Qian, and Yuen (CRYPTO’22), where the pseudorandomness property holds even when the generator can be queried adaptively or in superposition. We show feasibility of these variants assuming the existence of post-quantum one-way functions. 2. Classical Communication: We show that PRS generators with logarithmic output length imply commitment and encryption schemes with classical communication. Previous constructions of such schemes from PRS generators required quantum communication. 3. Simplified Proof: We give a simpler proof of the Brakerski–Shmueli (TCC’19) result that polynomially-many copies of uniform superposition states with random binary phases are indistinguishable from Haar-random states. 4. Necessity of Computational Assumptions: We also show that a secure PRS with output length logarithmic, or larger, in the key length necessarily requires computational assumptions. prabhanjan@cs.ucsb.edu adityagulati@ucsb.edu luowenq@bu.edu. Supported by DARPA under Agreement No. HR00112020023. hyuen@cs.columbia.edu. Supported by AFOSR award FA9550-21-1-0040 and NSF CAREER award CCF2144219. 1 ar X iv :2 21 1. 01 44 4v 1 [ qu an tph ] 2 N ov 2 02 2
papers.abstract_zh: 伪随机量子态(PRS)是可有效构造的态，在计算上与Haar-random是不可区分的，并且最近已经发现了密码学应用。我们探索了伪随机态的新定义、新性质和应用，并给出了以下贡献:1 .新定义:我们研究了Ananth、Qian和Yuen (CRYPTO'22)提出的类伪随机函数状态(PRFS)发生器的变体，其中即使当发生器可以被自适应地或叠加地查询时，伪随机性属性仍然成立。假设后量子单向函数的存在，我们展示了这些变体的可行性。2.经典通信:我们证明了对数输出长度的PRS生成器意味着经典通信的承诺和加密方案。以前从PRS生成器构造这样的方案需要量子通信。3.简化证明:我们给出了braker ski–shmu Eli(TCC ' 19)结果的一个更简单的证明，即具有随机二元相位的一致叠加态的多项式许多副本与Haar随机态是不可区分的。4.计算假设的必要性:我们还表明，密钥长度为对数或更大的安全PRS必然需要计算假设。prabhanjan@cs.ucsb.edu·adityagulati@ucsb.edu·luowenq@bu.edu。由DARPA根据HR00112020023号协议提供支持。hyuen@cs.columbia.edu。由AFOSR奖FA9550-21-1-0040和NSF职业奖CCF2144219资助。1 ar X iv :2 21 1。N在2之上

papers.title: Scalable and Transparent Proofs over All Large Fields, via Elliptic Curves - (ECFFT Part II)
papers.authors: Eli Ben-Sasson, Dan Carmon, Swastik Kopparty, David Levit
papers.abstract: Concretely efficient interactive oracle proofs (IOPs) are of interest due to their applications to scaling blockchains, their minimal security assumptions, and their potential future-proof resistance to quantum attacks. Scalable IOPs, in which prover time scales quasilinearly with the computation size and verifier time scales polylogarithmically with it, have been known to exist thus far only over a set of finite fields of negligible density, namely, over “FFT-friendly” fields that contain a sub-group of size 2. Our main result is to show that scalable IOPs can be constructed over any sufficiently large finite field, of size that is at least quadratic in the length of computation whose integrity is proved by the IOP. This result has practical applications as well, because it reduces the proving and verification complexity of cryptographic statements that are naturally stated over pre-defined finite fields which are not “FFT-friendly”. Prior state-of-the-art scalable IOPs relied heavily on arithmetization via univariate polynomials and Reed–Solomon codes over FFT-friendly fields. To prove our main result and extend scalability to all large finite fields, we generalize the prior techniques and use new algebraic geometry codes evaluated on sub-groups of elliptic curves (elliptic curve codes). We also show a new arithmetization scheme that uses the rich and well-understood group structure of elliptic curves to reduce statements of computational integrity to other statements about the proximity of functions evaluated on the elliptic curve to the new family of elliptic curve codes. This paper continues our recent work [BCKL21] that used elliptic curves and their subgroups to create FFT-based algorithms for polynomial manipulation over generic finite fields. However, our new IOP constructions force us to use new codes (ones that are not based on polynomials), and this poses a new set of challenges involving the more restricted automorphism group of these codes, and the constraints of Riemann–Roch spaces of strictly positive genus. *StarkWare Industries Ltd. {eli,dancar,david}@starkware.co †Department of Mathematics and Department of Computer Science, University of Toronto. swastik.kopparty@gmail.com
papers.abstract_zh: 具体有效的交互式oracle证明(IOPs)是令人感兴趣的，因为它们应用于扩展区块链，它们的最小安全假设，以及它们对量子攻击的潜在未来抵抗能力。到目前为止，已知仅在一组密度可忽略的有限域上，即在包含大小为2的子组的“FFT友好”域上，存在可扩展的IOPs，其中证明者时间尺度与计算大小准线性相关，而验证者时间尺度与计算大小多对数相关。我们的主要结果是表明，可扩展的IOPs可以在任何足够大的有限域上构建，其大小至少是计算长度的平方，其完整性由IOP来证明。该结果也具有实际应用，因为它降低了在非“FFT友好”的预定义有限域上自然陈述的密码语句的证明和验证复杂度。先前最先进的可扩展IOPs严重依赖于通过FFT友好域上的单变量多项式和Reed–Solomon码的算术化。为了证明我们的主要结果并将可扩展性扩展到所有大的有限域，我们推广了现有技术并使用在椭圆曲线的子群上评估的新的代数几何码(椭圆曲线码)。我们还展示了一种新的算术化方案，该方案使用丰富且易于理解的椭圆曲线的群结构来将计算完整性的陈述简化为关于在椭圆曲线上评估的函数与新的椭圆曲线码族的接近性的其他陈述。本文继续我们最近的工作[BCKL21],使用椭圆曲线及其子群创建基于FFT的算法，用于一般有限域上的多项式操作。然而，我们新的IOP构造迫使我们使用新的代码(不是基于多项式的代码)，这提出了一系列新的挑战，涉及这些代码的更受限的自同构群，以及严格正亏格的Riemann-Roch空间的约束。* {eli,dancar,david}@starkware.co stark ware工业有限公司多伦多大学数学系和计算机科学系。swastik.kopparty@gmail.com
papers.title_zh: 通过椭圆曲线在所有大范围内进行可扩展和透明的证明

papers.title: Doubly Efficient Interactive Proofs over Infinite and Non-commutative Rings
papers.authors: Eduardo Soria-Vazquez
papers.abstract: . We introduce the ﬁrst proof system for layered arithmetic circuits over an arbitrary ring R that is (possibly) non-commutative and (possibly) inﬁnite, while only requiring black-box access to its arithmetic and a subset A ⊆ R . Our construction only requires limited commutativity and regularity properties from A , similar to recent work on eﬃcient information theoretic multi-party computation over non-commutative rings by Escudero and Soria-Vazquez ( CRYPTO 2021 ), but furthermore covering inﬁnite rings. We achieve our results through a generalization of GKR-style interactive proofs (Goldwasser, Kalai and Rothblum, Journal of the ACM , 2015). When A is a subset of the center of R , generalizations of the sum-check protocol and other building blocks are not too problematic. The case when the elements of A only commute with each other, on the other hand, introduces a series of challenges. In order to overcome those, we need to introduce a new deﬁnition of polynomial ring over a non-commutative ring, the notion of left (and right ) multi-linear extensions, modify the layer consistency equation and adapt the sum-check protocol. Despite these changes, our results are compatible with recent developments such as linear time provers. Moreover, for certain rings our construction achieves provers that run in sublinear time in the circuit size. We obtain such result both for known cases, such as matrix and polynomial rings, as well as new ones, such as for some rings resulting from Cliﬀord algebras. Besides eﬃciency improvements in computation and/or round complexity for several instantiations, the core conclusion of our results is that state of the art doubly eﬃcient interactive proofs do not require much algebraic structure. This enables exact rather than approximate computation over inﬁnite rings as well as “agile” proof systems, where the black-box choice of the underlying ring can be easily switched through the software life
papers.abstract_zh: 。我们为(可能)不可交换且(可能)无限的任意环r上的分层算术电路引入了第一个证明系统，同时只需要对其算术和子集A ⊆ R进行黑盒访问。我们的构造只需要来自a的有限交换性和正则性属性，类似于Escudero和Soria-Vazquez ( CRYPTO 2021)最近对非交换环上的eﬃcient信息论多方计算所做的工作，但还覆盖了有限环。我们通过推广GKR式的交互式证明来实现我们的结果(Goldwasser，Kalai和Rothblum，美国计算机学会杂志，2015年)。当A是R的中心的子集时，总和检查协议和其他构造块的一般化不是太大的问题。另一方面，当的元素仅相互交换时，引入了一系列挑战。为了克服这些问题，我们需要引入非交换环上多项式环的新定义，左(和右)多线性扩展的概念，修改层一致性方程并修改校验和协议。尽管有这些变化，我们的结果与最近的发展是一致的，如线性时间证明。此外，对于某些环，我们的结构实现了在电路规模上以次线性时间运行的证明器。我们得到了这样的结果，既有已知的情况，如矩阵环和多项式环，也有新的情况，如某些由Cliﬀord代数产生的环。除了eﬃciency对几个实例的计算和/或循环复杂度的改进，我们结果的核心结论是现有技术的双重eﬃcient交互证明不需要太多的代数结构。这实现了对无限环和“敏捷”验证系统的精确而非近似计算，其中底层环的黑盒选择可以在软件生命周期中轻松切换

papers.title: Round Optimal Secure Multiparty Computation from Minimal Assumptions
papers.authors: Arka Rai Choudhuri, Michele Ciampi, Vipul Goyal, Abhishek Jain, Rafail Ostrovsky
papers.abstract: Secure Multiparty Computation (MPC) allows a set of parties, each having its own private data, to compute a function of their joint data such that the parties only learn the output of this function and everything else about their data is hidden. MPC is a fundamental cryptographic abstraction that captures many other natural cryptographic primitives as special cases. It also has a wide range of practical applications such as conducting secure electronic auctions, delegating sensitive computation to untrusted cloud service providers, secure computation on genomic data and training machine learning models on private data.A long-standing open problem in this area is to construct MPC protocols that have {\it optimal} (two-round) round complexity under the {\it weakest} possible cryptographic hardness assumptions.We {\it completely resolve} this problem by showing lower bounds and matching upper bounds on the hardness assumptions required for constructing round-optimal MPC. Specifically, we obtain the following results.\begin{itemize}\item \textbf{Black-Box Separation.} We show that there exists no construction of two-round semi-honest MPC protocol for general functions that makes black-box use of a two-round oblivious transfer. As a corollary, a similar separation holds when starting with any 2-party functionality other than oblivious transfer. \item \textbf{Non-Black-Box Construction.} We show that the above negative result can be bypassed by making non-black-box use of a two-round oblivious transfer. Specifically, starting from a semi-honest (resp. malicious) secure two-round oblivious transfer protocol, we construct a two-round MPC protocol against semi-honest (resp. malicious) adversaries. \end{itemize}Since any two-round MPC protocol for general functionalities implies a two-round oblivious transfer as a special case, the above two results show that non-black-box use of oblivious transfer is {\it necessary and sufficient} to construct round-optimal MPC protocols.
papers.abstract_zh: 安全多方计算(MPC)允许一组各方(每一方都有自己的私有数据)计算他们的联合数据的函数，使得各方只知道该函数的输出，而关于他们的数据的其他一切都是隐藏的。MPC是一个基本的加密抽象，它将许多其他自然加密原语作为特例来捕获。它还具有广泛的实际应用，例如进行安全的电子拍卖，将敏感计算委托给不可信的云服务提供商，对基因组数据进行安全计算，以及对私人数据训练机器学习模型。在这个领域中一个长期存在的公开问题是构造MPC协议，该协议在可能的最弱加密硬度假设下具有最优(两轮)轮复杂度。我们通过显示下限和匹配上限来完全解决这个问题，这是构建圆最优MPC所需的硬度假设。具体来说，我们获得了以下结果。\ begin {逐项列出} \ item \ textbf {黑盒分离。我们证明了对于一般函数，不存在使用两轮不经意传输的两轮半诚实MPC协议的构造。作为推论，当从除了不经意传输之外的任何两方功能开始时，类似的分离成立。\ item \ textbf {非黑盒结构。我们证明了通过使用两轮不经意传输的非黑盒可以绕过上述否定结果。具体来说，从一个半诚实(resp。恶意)安全的两轮不经意传输协议，我们构造了一个抗半诚实(resp。恶意)对手。由于一般功能的两轮MPC协议都包含两轮不经意传输作为特例，因此上述两个结果表明，不经意传输的非黑盒使用是构造轮最优MPC协议的必要和充分条件。
papers.title_zh: 基于最小假设的舍入最优安全多方计算

papers.title: Quantum Encryption with Certified Deletion
papers.authors: Anne Broadbent, Rabib Islam
papers.abstract: Given a ciphertext, is it possible to prove the deletion of the underlying plaintext? Since classical ciphertexts can be copied, clearly such a feat is impossible using classical information alone. In stark contrast to this, we show that quantum encodings enable certified deletion. More precisely, we show that it is possible to encrypt classical data into a quantum ciphertext such that the recipient of the ciphertext can produce a classical string which proves to the originator that the recipient has relinquished any chance of recovering the plaintext should the decryption key be revealed. Our scheme is feasible with current quantum technology: the honest parties only require quantum devices for single-qubit preparation and measurements; the scheme is also robust against noise in these devices. Furthermore, we provide an analysis that is suitable in the finite-key regime.
papers.abstract_zh: 给定一个密文，是否有可能证明删除底层明文？由于经典密文可以被复制，很明显，仅仅使用经典信息是不可能做到这一点的。与此形成鲜明对比的是，我们表明量子编码支持认证删除。更准确地说，我们证明了将经典数据加密成量子密文是可能的，使得密文的接收者可以产生一个经典字符串，该字符串向发起者证明，如果解密密钥被泄露，接收者已经放弃了恢复明文的任何机会。我们的方案在当前的量子技术下是可行的:诚实的一方只需要量子器件来进行单量子比特的制备和测量；该方案对于这些设备中的噪声也是鲁棒的。此外，我们还提供了一个适用于有限密钥机制的分析。

papers.title: Expected-Time Cryptography: Generic Techniques and Applications to Concrete Soundness
papers.authors: Joseph Jaeger, Stefano Tessaro
papers.abstract: This paper studies concrete security with respect to expected-time adversaries. Our first contribution is a set of generic tools to obtain tight bounds on the advantage of an adversary with expected-time guarantees. We apply these tools to derive bounds in the random-oracle and genericgroup models, which we show to be tight. As our second contribution, we use these results to derive concrete bounds on the soundness of publiccoin proofs and arguments of knowledge. Under the lens of concrete security, we revisit a paradigm by Bootle at al. (EUROCRYPT ’16) that proposes a general Forking Lemma for multi-round protocols which implements a rewinding strategy with expected-time guarantees. We give a tighter analysis, as well as a modular statement. We adopt this to obtain the first quantitative bounds on the soundness of Bulletproofs (Bünz et al., S&P 2018), which we instantiate with our expected-time generic-group analysis to surface inherent dependence between the concrete security and the statement to be proved.
papers.abstract_zh: 本文研究预期时间对手的具体安全性。我们的第一个贡献是一套通用的工具，以获得在预期时间保证下对手优势的严格界限。我们应用这些工具来推导随机预言模型和一般群模型中的界限，我们证明这是严格的。作为我们的第二个贡献，我们使用这些结果来推导知识的公开硬币证明和论证的可靠性的具体界限。在具体安全的视角下，我们重温了Bootle at al的一个范式。(EUROCRYPT '16)提出了用于多轮协议的一般分叉引理，该引理实现了具有期望时间保证的重绕策略。我们给出了更严密的分析，以及模块化的陈述。我们采用这种方法来获得关于Bulletproofs可靠性的第一个定量界限(Bünz等人，S&P，2018)，我们用我们的期望时间类属群分析来实例化该界限，以揭示具体安全性和要证明的陈述之间的内在相关性。

papers.title: Interactive Non-malleable Codes
papers.authors: Nils Fleischhacker, Vipul Goyal, Abhishek Jain, Anat Paskin-Cherniavsky, Slava Radune
papers.abstract: . Interactive Non-Malleable Codes were introduced by Fleischhacker et al. (TCC 2019) in the two party setting with synchronous tampering. The idea of this type of non-malleable code is that it “encodes” an interactive protocol in such a way that, even if the messages are tampered with according to some class F of tampering functions, the result of the execution will either be correct, or completely unrelated to the inputs of the participating parties. In the synchronous setting the adversary is able to modify the messages being exchanged but cannot drop messages nor desynchronize the two parties by ﬁrst running the protocol with the ﬁrst party and then with the second party. In this work, we deﬁne interactive non-malleable codes in the non-synchronous multi-party setting and construct such interactive non-malleable codes for the class F s bounded of bounded-state tampering functions. The construction is applicable to any multi-party protocol with a ﬁxed message topology.
papers.abstract_zh: 。Fleischhacker等人(TCC 2019)在具有同步篡改的双方设置中引入了交互式非延展性代码。这种类型的不可延展代码的思想是，它以这样一种方式“编码”交互协议，即使消息根据一些F类篡改函数被篡改，执行的结果将是正确的，或者与参与方的输入完全无关。在同步设置中，对手能够修改正在交换的消息，但是不能丢弃消息，也不能通过首先与第一方然后与第二方运行协议来使双方不同步。在这项工作中，我们在非同步多方设置中定义了交互式不可延展代码，并为类F的有界状态篡改函数构造了这样的交互式不可延展代码。该结构适用于任何具有固定消息拓扑的多方协议。

papers.title: Efficient Information-Theoretic Secure Multiparty Computation over Z/pkZ via Galois Rings
papers.authors: Mark Abspoel, Ronald Cramer, Ivan Damgård, Daniel Escudero, Chen Yuan
papers.abstract: , Abstract. At CRYPTO 2018, Cramer et al. introduced a secret-sharing based protocol called SPD Z 2 k that allows for secure multiparty computation (MPC) in the dishonest majority setting over the ring of integers modulo 2 k , thus solving a long-standing open question in MPC about secure computation over rings in this setting. In this paper we study this problem in the information-theoretic scenario. More speciﬁcally, we ask the following question: Can we obtain information-theoretic MPC protocols that work over rings with comparable eﬃciency to corresponding protocols over ﬁelds? We answer this question in the aﬃrmative by presenting an eﬃcient protocol for robust Secure Multiparty Computation over Z /p k Z (for any prime p and positive integer k ) that is perfectly secure against active adversaries corrupting a fraction of at most 1 / 3 players, and a robust protocol that is statistically secure against an active adversary corrupting a fraction of at most 1 / 2 players.
papers.abstract_zh: ，抽象。在CRYPTO 2018上，Cramer等人推出了一种名为SPD Z 2 k的基于秘密共享的协议，该协议允许在以2 k为模的整数环上的不诚实多数设置中的安全多方计算(MPC ),从而解决了MPC中关于这种设置中环上的安全计算的长期未决问题。在本文中，我们在信息论的场景中研究这个问题。更具体地说，我们提出以下问题:我们能否获得在环上工作的信息论MPC协议，其eﬃciency与域上的相应协议相当？我们在aﬃrmative中通过提出Z /p k Z(对于任何素数p和正整数k)上的鲁棒安全多方计算的eﬃcient协议来回答这个问题，该协议对于破坏至多1 / 3参与者的一部分的主动对手是完全安全的，并且对于破坏至多1 / 2参与者的一部分的主动对手是统计安全的。
papers.title_zh: 基于Galois环的Z/pkZ上高效的信息论安全多方计算

papers.title: The Security of Lazy Users in Out-of-Band Authentication
papers.authors: Moni Naor, Lior Rotem, Gil Segev
papers.abstract: Faced with the threats posed by man-in-the-middle attacks, messaging platforms rely on “out-of-band” authentication, assuming that users have access to an external channel for authenticating one short value. For example, assuming that users recognizing each other’s voice can authenticate a short value, Telegram and WhatApp ask their users to compare 288-bit and 200-bit values, respectively. The existing protocols, however, do not take into account the plausible behavior of users who may be “lazy” and only compare parts of these values (rather than their entirety). Motivated by such a security-critical user behavior, we study the security of lazy users in out-of-band authentication. We start by showing that both the protocol implemented by WhatsApp and the statistically optimal protocol of Naor, Segev, and Smith (CRYPTO’06) are completely vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks when the users consider only a half of the out-of-band authenticated value. In this light, we put forward a framework that captures the behavior and security of lazy users. Our notions of security consider both statistical security and computational security, and for each flavor we derive a lower bound on the tradeoff between the number of positions that are considered by the lazy users and the adversary’s forgery probability. Within our framework, we then provide two authentication protocols. First, in the statistical setting, we present a transformation that converts any out-of-band authentication protocol into one that is secure even when executed by lazy users. Instantiating our transformation with a new refinement of the protocol of Naor et al. results in a protocol whose tradeoff essentially matches our lower bound in the statistical setting. Then, in the computational setting, we show that the computationally optimal protocol of Vaudenay (CRYPTO’05) is secure even when executed by lazy users—and its tradeoff matches our lower bound in the computational setting.
papers.abstract_zh: 面对中间人攻击带来的威胁，消息传递平台依赖于“带外”身份验证，假设用户可以访问外部通道来验证一个短值。例如，假设用户识别对方的声音可以认证一个短值，Telegram和WhatApp分别要求其用户比较288位和200位的值。然而，现有的协议没有考虑可能“懒惰”的用户的合理行为，并且只比较这些值的一部分(而不是全部)。受这种安全关键用户行为的激励，我们研究了带外认证中懒惰用户的安全性。我们首先表明，当用户只考虑带外认证值的一半时，WhatsApp实现的协议和Naor、Segev和Smith (CRYPTO'06)的统计最优协议都完全容易受到中间人攻击。有鉴于此，我们提出了一个框架来捕捉懒惰用户的行为和安全性。我们的安全概念考虑了统计安全和计算安全，并且对于每一种风格，我们都推导出懒惰用户所考虑的位置数量和对手的伪造概率之间的折衷的下界。在我们的框架中，我们提供了两个认证协议。首先，在统计设置中，我们给出了一个转换，它将任何带外身份验证协议转换成一个即使由懒惰用户执行也是安全的协议。用Naor等人的协议的新改进来实例化我们的变换，导致协议的折衷基本上匹配我们在统计设置中的下限。然后，在计算环境中，我们证明了计算最优的Vaudenay协议(CRYPTO'05)即使在被懒惰用户执行时也是安全的——并且它的折衷匹配我们在计算环境中的下限。
